MENUPAGE_BETA_DIALOG_BDY: talkwall is under beta testing at some schools.
MENUPAGE_BROWSER_PRIVATEMODE_WARNING_TOA: Turn private browsing off to log in
MENUPAGE_BROWSER_TYPE_WARNING_TOAST: This site is best viewed on Chrome or Firefox. You are using a different browser.
MENUPAGE_CREATEDRAWER_HEADING: You may log in to this talkwall using one of the following
MENUPAGE_FOOTER1: The DiDiAC project is a collaboration between the University of Cambridge and the University of Oslo. It is funded by The Research Council of Norway.
MENUPAGE_HEADING_1: A digital tool with the potential to stimulate, enhance and transform dialogic teaching and learning.
MENUPAGE_HEADING_2: For teachers that want to promote effective dialogue in their classroom.
MENUPAGE_PARTICIPATEDRAWER_HEADING: Enter name and the PIN code
MENUPAGE_STATEMENT1: - I'm reminded about the students’ level of understanding. (Teacher)
MENUPAGE_STATEMENT2: - Several students may pose the same answer when we write microblogs. You can't do that if you have to show hands. Then only one gets to answer (Junior student)
MENUPAGE_THUMB1_BDY: Learn about dialogic teaching. Dialogue is talk with a very distinct character and purpose, designed to enable people to come to an understanding of one another’s knowledge and perspectives, and to build ones.
MENUPAGE_THUMB2_BDY: A practical guide to using Talkwall. We have collected screen shots and step by step instructions along the way.
MENUPAGE_THUMB3_BDY: Share your experiences and inspirations for using Talkwall. Find a way of using Talkwall, as described and evaluated by the contributing teachers.
WALL_CLOSEMSG: All contributions on this Talkwall will be sent by email to:
